title: Looking something similar to Foundry Form serif typeface
content:
I'm looking for a slightly condensed typeface - similar to Foundry Form serif but not that one. I like the most of all glyph but I do not like the f, the j serif and the lower case accent.  
André

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030071917im_/http:/typophile.com/files/VictorKiam_4622.png)
  
(here a sample of Foundry Form serif)

Any suggestions are welcome. Thanks
author: sim

comments.content:
[  
FF Olsen](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030071917/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=Olsen)  
 [FF Page Serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030071917/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FF.11399.0.0)

{BTW, whichever moderator spliced in the links to those  
two fonts (probably Stephen) please know that I don't take  
that for granted! I'm just lazy either way. So a big thanks.}

hhp

Hrant, where can I see a sample of Patria and can I buy this typeface?  
Thanks

André

[http://www.themicrofoundry.com/ad/CR.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030071917/http:/www.themicrofoundry.com/ad/CR.pdf "http://www.themicrofoundry.com/ad/CR.pdf") \_  
Please contact me for the full specimen, etc.  
hpapazian\_thatsymbol\_gmail\_dot\_com

hhp

I finally choose Cartier book family [http://www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=261337](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030071917/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=261337 "http://www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=261337")

Thanks for the really good suggestions.

André
